decks.notes: This deck focuses on using the Esper color combination to control the opponent's board while also maintaining a fast-paced aggressive strategy. Utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's plans, while Aether Vial helps deploy creatures quickly. The deck also includes a variety of powerful creatures such as Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of control and aggression.

The main focus of the deck is to assemble a powerful combo using Mystic Forge and various artifacts to generate mana and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Grim Monolith, Glaring Fleshraker, and Urza's Tower, the deck aims to create a strong board presence and quickly overwhelm the opponent. With Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator for additional support, the deck is designed to efficiently retrieve and play key pieces to achieve victory. With careful sequencing and strategic decision-making, the deck can create explosive plays and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library and win the game. The deck includes cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to tutor for and recur combo pieces, while also running disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. Urza's Saga is used to find key artifacts like Grindstone or Soul-Guide Lantern. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its combo win condition.

This deck focuses on efficiently filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also utilizes powerful disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its game plan. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and versatility. The deck aims to quickly reanimate threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent, while maintaining control of the game with removal and counter spells.

The key strategy of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to draw cards and sculpt the hand with Brainstorm and Ponder, while also utilizing counterspells like Force of Will to protect key threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. It also has a mix of creatures like Baleful Strix and Barrowgoyf to provide additional threats and blockers. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the heavy Blue presence alongside Black and White cards.

This deck aims to cheat powerful creatures into play quickly and unexpectedly using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By using these cards along with Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with massive threats that can end the game in just a few turns. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Brainstorm provide ways to protect the combo pieces and ensure a smooth execution of the game plan. The key strategy is to surprise the opponent with game-ending creatures before they have a chance to respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combination of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. By casting Doomsday and using its ability to stack the library in a specific order, the goal is to ensure that Thassa's Oracle will be the last remaining card to win the game upon resolution. The deck includes various card draw and mana acceleration spells to help set up the Doomsday combo efficiently. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will provide disruption to protect the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cards to quickly and efficiently deck oneself out in order to win the game using Thassa's Oracle. The strategy involves using cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual to generate fast mana, while also utilizing cards like Boggart Trawler and Balustrade Spy to mill through the deck. Pact of Negation helps protect the combo, while Cabal Therapy disrupts the opponent's game plan. Reanimate can also be used to bring back key pieces, while Once Upon a Time helps with consistency in finding necessary combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize artifacts and mana acceleration to assemble the Mystic Forge combo. The deck aims to use cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga to tutor for key pieces like Grim Monolith, Basalt Monolith, and Voltaic Key to generate infinite mana and draw through the entire deck with Mystic Forge. The win condition typically involves casting cards like Glaring Fleshraker or Kozilek's Command to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game quickly through its powerful combo potential.

The main concept of this Deadguy Ale deck is to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures such as Emperor of Bones, Barrowgoyf, and Ocelot Pride, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude to deal with threats. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a powerful planeswalker finisher. The mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This Dragon Stompy Legacy deck focuses on locking down opponents with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's mana bases and tempo while also providing a fast clock to pressure opponents into making suboptimal plays. The inclusion of cards like Ghost Vacuum, Fury, and Sundering Eruption allows for removal and flexibility in dealing with threats, while cards like The One Ring and Vexing Bauble provide card advantage and deck manipulation.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to deal with key threats from the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and staying ahead on the board, this Dimir Tempo deck aims to close out the game quickly and decisively.
